results.title: Comparative effects of amlodipine and nifedipine GITS during treatment and after missing two doses.
results.text_hl: Peak reduction @DISEASE_Isolated_Systolic_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000092244 @@@in systolic@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@blood pressure@@@ was 26/15mmHg at 5-6h after ingestion of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ tablets.

citations.NLM: Hernández RH, Armas-Hernández MJ, Chourio JA, Armas-Padilla MC, López L, Alvarez M, Pacheco B. Comparative effects of amlodipine and nifedipine GITS during treatment and after missing two doses. Blood Press Monit. 2001 Feb;6(1):47-57. PMID: 11248761

results.title: Evaluation of amlodipine, lisinopril, and a combination in the treatment of essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: Twenty four @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic blood pressure@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@) between 95 and 104 mm Hg received @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ 2.5 mg and 5 mg, @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 5 mg and 10 mg, and their combination as per a prior randomisation schedule.

citations.NLM: Naidu MU, Usha PR, Rao TR, Shobha JC. Evaluation of amlodipine, lisinopril, and a combination in the treatment of essential hypertension. Postgrad Med J. 2000 Jun;76(896):350-3. PMID: 10824049
citations.BibTeX: @article{10824049, title={Evaluation of amlodipine, lisinopril, and a combination in the treatment of essential hypertension.}, author={Naidu MU and Usha PR and Rao TR and Shobha JC}, journal={Postgrad Med J}, volume={76}, number={896}, pages={350-3}}

results.title: Double-blind evaluation of the dose-response relationship of amlodipine in essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@, 1.25 mg daily, was also associated with a decrease in standing @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic blood pressure@@@.

citations.NLM: Mehta JL, Lopez LM, Vlachakis ND, Gradman AH, Nash DT, O'Connell MT, Garland WT, Pickering BI. Double-blind evaluation of the dose-response relationship of amlodipine in essential hypertension. Am Heart J. 1993 Jun;125(6):1704-10. PMID: 8498314

results.title: Efficacy of initiating therapy with amlodipine and hydrochlorothiazide or their combination in hypertensive Nigerians.
results.text_hl: In the @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@-@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ group, 27 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (90%) and 15 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (50%) had @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic blood pressure@@@ <90 mm Hg and blood pressure < 140/90 mm Hg, respectively.

citations.NLM: Iyalomhe GB, Omogbai EK, Isah AO, Iyalomhe OO, Dada FL, Iyalomhe SI. Efficacy of initiating therapy with amlodipine and hydrochlorothiazide or their combination in hypertensive Nigerians. Clin Exp Hypertens. 2013;35(8):620-7. PMID: 23510493

results.title: Comparing antihypertensive effect and plasma ciclosporin concentration between amlodipine and valsartan regimens in hypertensive renal transplant patients receiving ciclosporin therapy.
results.text_hl: However, the reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic BP@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@) was significantly greater in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ group compared with the @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@ group at 12, 16, and 24 weeks of treatment.

citations.NLM: Cai J, Huang Z, Yang G, Cheng K, Ye Q, Ming Y, Zuo X, Zhou P, Yuan H. Comparing antihypertensive effect and plasma ciclosporin concentration between amlodipine and valsartan regimens in hypertensive renal transplant patients receiving ciclosporin therapy. Am J Cardiovasc Drugs. 2011 Dec 1;11(6):401-9. PMID: 22149319

results.title: Main results of the losartan versus amlodipine (LOA) study on drug tolerability and psychological general well-being. LOA Study Group.
results.text_hl: After 4 weeks of placebo, @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic blood pressure@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@) in the range 95-115 mmHg were allocated randomly to be administered 50 mg @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ (increased to 100 mg if the @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@ was 90 mmHg or more after 6 weeks), 50 mg @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ (plus 12.5 mg @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ under the above conditions), or 5 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (increased to 10 mg under the above condition).

citations.NLM: Dahlöf B, Lindholm LH, Carney S, Pentikäinen PJ, Ostergren J. Main results of the losartan versus amlodipine (LOA) study on drug tolerability and psychological general well-being. LOA Study Group. J Hypertens. 1997 Nov;15(11):1327-35. PMID: 9383183
citations.BibTeX: @article{9383183, title={Main results of the losartan versus amlodipine (LOA) study on drug tolerability and psychological general well-being. LOA Study Group.}, author={Dahlöf B and Lindholm LH and Carney S and Pentikäinen PJ and Ostergren J}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={15}, number={11}, pages={1327-35}}

results.title: [Amlodipine in long-term treatment of mild and moderate hypertension. A multicenter study].
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: These results indicate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ effects sustained @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@reduction in diastolic blood pressure@@@ over a period of more than 3 years in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with mild to moderate @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Sauerbrey-Wullkopf N, Anlauf M. [Amlodipine in long-term treatment of mild and moderate hypertension. A multicenter study]. Fortschr Med. 1995 Feb 20;113(5):58-62. PMID: 7721221
citations.BibTeX: @article{7721221, title={[Amlodipine in long-term treatment of mild and moderate hypertension. A multicenter study].}, author={Sauerbrey-Wullkopf N and Anlauf M}, journal={Fortschr Med}, volume={113}, number={5}, pages={58-62}}

results.title: Randomized, comparative, double-blind study of amlodipine vs. nicardipine as a treatment of isolated systolic hypertension in the elderly.
results.text_hl: The two treatments substantially and comparably reduced office systolic blood pressure (SBP) and pulse pressure (PP), and also produced a slight decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic blood pressure@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@).

citations.NLM: Mounier-Véhier C, Jaboureck O, Emeriau JP, Bernaud C, Clerson P, Carre A. Randomized, comparative, double-blind study of amlodipine vs. nicardipine as a treatment of isolated systolic hypertension in the elderly. Fundam Clin Pharmacol. 2002 Dec;16(6):537-44. PMID: 12685513
citations.BibTeX: @article{12685513, title={Randomized, comparative, double-blind study of amlodipine vs. nicardipine as a treatment of isolated systolic hypertension in the elderly.}, author={Mounier-Véhier C and Jaboureck O and Emeriau JP and Bernaud C and Clerson P and Carre A}, journal={Fundam Clin Pharmacol}, volume={16}, number={6}, pages={537-44}}

results.title: Mibefradil in the treatment of systemic hypertension: comparative studies with other calcium antagonists.
results.text_hl: Treatment with 100 mg @CHEMICAL_Mibefradil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020748 @@@mibefradil@@@ or 10 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ once daily resulted in statistically significant decreases from baseline in @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@SDBP@@@ of 11.5 +/- 8.2 mm Hg and 13.2 +/- 7.9 mm Hg, respectively, which were statistically equivalent.

citations.NLM: Massie BM, Lacourcière Y, Viskoper R, Woittiez A, Kobrin I. Mibefradil in the treatment of systemic hypertension: comparative studies with other calcium antagonists. Am J Cardiol. 1997 Aug 21;80(4B):27C-33C. PMID: 9286851
citations.BibTeX: @article{9286851, title={Mibefradil in the treatment of systemic hypertension: comparative studies with other calcium antagonists.}, author={Massie BM and Lacourcière Y and Viskoper R and Woittiez A and Kobrin I}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={80}, number={4B}, pages={27C-33C}}

results.title: CYP3A4*1G and CYP3A5*3 genetic polymorphisms alter the antihypertensive efficacy of amlodipine in patients with hypertension following renal transplantation : .
results.text_hl: Materials: Blood samples were collected from 76 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ therapy (5 mg/d).
